channel.title: Personal on Pulse
channel.description: Recent content in Personal on Pulse

item.title: Handoff Notes in CoPilot
item.description:
A Quick post this time -

I stumbled upon a great workflow feature in Copilot today that I wanted to share.

While in a long session, Copilot suggested taking a break and offered to create a Handoff Note. This allows you to pause your work without losing the context of your discussion or code changes.

item.title: More Than a Movie: My Pilgrimage to David Gilmour‚Äôs Live at the Circus Maximus
item.description: I want to talk about an experience I had last night. I didn’t just go to the movies. As I noted in my recent review, it felt more like a “pilgrimage.” The film was David Gilmour’s Live at the Circus Maximus, and it felt like a temporal echo‚Äîa chance to relive a legendary performance on a scale so grand it felt like you were breathing the very air of that historic night.

item.title: Happy New Year, everyone! Welcome to 2026.
item.description:
Happy New Year, everyone! Welcome to 2026.

As the calendar turns a new page, I find myself reflecting on the moments that brought us here‚Äîthe joys, the challenges, and the quiet resilience we‚Äôve all built. As per my yearly tradition, I wanted to share something that grounds me and brings peace to my soul.

item.title: Stereo Amplifiers: The Audiophile's choice for 2.1 and Vinyl
item.description: For listeners whose primary focus is two-channel (stereo) music listening, especially the rich, analog sound of vinyl records, a dedicated integrated stereo amplifier (often just called a stereo amplifier) is generally preferred over a multi-channel AV receiver (AVR). This preference is rooted in audio fidelity, design philosophy, and specific requirements for turntable playback.

item.title: Architecting Tomorrow
item.description: Explore the future of IT at UCSB with “Architecting Tomorrow,” a short film introducing our Enterprise Architecture group! This video provides an engaging, animated look into who we are, what we do, and our vision for a more connected and efficient technological landscape at UCSB.

item.title: Review of David Gilmour's new album : Luck and Strange
item.description: üéµ David Gilmour‚Äôs much-anticipated album Luck and Strange dropped on September 6, marking his first release in nine years since Rattle That Lock. Fans were eagerly waiting, especially after preview tracks like “The Piper‚Äôs Call,” “Between Two Points,” and “Dark and Velvet Nights” hinted at a mix of the familiar Pink Floyd essence and something new.

item.title: Some updates of me
item.description:
Hey everyone! I know it’s been a while since my last update ‚Äì things have been incredibly busy with both work and my YouTube channel!

Work Update:

On the professional side, we‚Äôre making solid progress on our massive ERP project: the Oracle Financial Cloud deployment. This project is a beast, with over a hundred swim lanes of technical and functional scopes. It‚Äôs definitely a challenge to keep up with everything that needs to be done between now and our launch date in July 2025. But hey, nothing worth doing ever comes easy, right?

item.title: My YouTube Channel iGluon
item.description: Those who know or follow me know I had my own Sole proprietorship in the early 1990s. I am very proud of what I did with my business back then; unfortunately, I had to close that business eventually due to demand from my daytime job. Recently, I started a new YouTube channel based on my old business name, “iGluon.” I have a lot of ideas to create content that users may find helpful. But for now, I posted a few videos; the acceptance was incredible. In less than a month, my channel got over 8,000 views. My subscriber grew from 3 to 28 also. This is good progress, and I would love to keep up the momentum.

item.title: Embracing 2024: A Year of Reflection and Renewal
item.description:
Hey everyone!

As we step into the fresh canvas of 2024, I find myself in a reflective mood, contemplating the journey we’ve all been through and the exciting path that lies ahead. This isn’t just another year; it’s an opportunity for growth, resilience, and embracing new possibilities.

item.title: Exciting Milestone in my Software Engineering Journey!
item.description:
Today, I’m thrilled to share a monumental shift in my 30-plus years of software engineering career ‚Äì the decision to make the Mac my primary work station! üçé

Looking back, my journey began with Windows, possibly starting with the era of Windows 3.0. It’s where I acquired my foundational computing skills and built the pillars of my engineering career, primarily on various Microsoft platforms.

item.title: Depeche Mode Suffer Well Vinyl
item.description: Diving into the final chapter of our Depeche Mode series with “Suffer Well.” üé∂ Immerse yourself in the magnetic sounds of Dave Gahan that truly captivate in this track. üåü Enjoy the ride! üöÄ Also, spiced it up with clips from the unforgettable Memento Mori concert in Las Vegas, December 2023. üé§üî•

item.title: Phil Collins & Philip Bailey Vinyl
item.description: üéµ Immerse yourself in the timeless melodies of Phil Collins! üìÄ Our latest video features his iconic music, creating a nostalgic vinyl experience. üö´ No copyright infringement is intended; we’re sharing the magic of music purely for the love of it. üíô Support the artist by grabbing the record and let the tunes become a cherished part of your collection! üé∂ #PhilCollins #VinylExperience #MusicLovers

item.title: Depeche Mode Concert Memento Mori
item.description: Attended Depeche Mode Concert Memento Mori at Las Vegas on 12/1/2023. My Youtube Post shows some of it, hope you enjoy -

item.title: In the air tonight - Phil Collins
item.description:
This post is a duplicate of the previous one due to a software glitch that caused sound issues.

üé∂ Take a trip down memory lane with the timeless classic “In the Air Tonight” by Phil Collins, played on a vintage vinyl record. Let the warm crackle and rich tones transport you back in time. üï∞Ô∏è Sit back, relax, and experience the magic of this iconic track as it spins on the turntable.

item.title: Happy Holidays and New year 2023
item.description: The year 2023 is approaching us quickly. At the end of 2022, I would like to share 12 hand-picked ayaat (verses) from the Quran. May 2023 brings you happiness, peace and prosper.

item.title: Pink Floyd Concert in Los Angeles - Roger with brothers!
item.description: I am a classic Rock fan. I bought a ticket to go with my brothers and daughter to see Roger Waters - This is not a drill in Cryptoarena Los Angeles.

item.title: My reflections on Suratul Taha
item.description:
This post is different than what I have usually post.

The sura is Taha in Quran, and the sura summarizes the entire adventure when Allah appeared to Prophet Musa in the holy mountains of Tuwa.

item.title: Bing Image Gallery and Power Automate
item.description: I downloaded the Bing wallpaper app. It is actually awesome, everyday I turn on my computer to see what kind of wall paper I get for that day. Most of these are amazing! I use them in my desktop and also as my zoom background! Finally, I created a small Power Automate routine, that downloads each day Bing wall paper and saves it on to my drive.

item.title: Movies/Shows I recommend - Netflix
item.description: This post is for those who love movies and shows like me. I will try to post rare finds that are not always 100% scoring in rotten tomatoes nevertheless in my opinion well worth it to watch. Today’s posts can all be viewed in Netflix.

item.title: Yaheya.Com new site!
item.description:
After many years, moved my personal site to Hugo, previously DotNet Core Azure Web App. Details of current site can be found here

Hugo which is the main platform this site runs under is a brilliant idea. Not all sites, needs to be generated off from a Database or need backend server technology.
